title: Ticket #1289: Custom Signals can be defined for vanilla universe jobs
description:
It is now possible to define a custom kill signal to be used when a vanilla universe job is killed instead of always hard killing the job. If 'kill_sig' is defined in the job description file, then the specified signal will be sent to the job in the case the job is to be killed (like condor_rm). By default, the starter will wait 'killing_timeout-1' seconds before sending the job a kill signal to forcibly kill the job. If the job description file contains 'kill_sig_timeout', then the starter will wait the shorter of killing_timeout-1 and kill_sig_timeout before sending the job the kill signal.

The signal definition/escalation described above is not available on windows.

Change sourced from GT#1198
remarks:
kill_sig_timeout is a new submit description file command. It is associated with the job ClassAd attribute KillSigTimeout

These submit commands and associated attributes apply to all universes other than the standard universe, so this ticket (and derived from #1198) are incorrect.
